byline.contributor: Sarah Cohen and Griff Palmer contributed reporting.
byline.original: By KATIE THOMAS and ROBERT PEAR

abstract: Government officials release most detailed report to date on Medicare spending, revealing intricate picture of 36 million patients and $103 billion in total expenditures; heartburn medication Nexium, which accounted for largest spending on single drug, was prescribed to 1.5 million patients at total cost of $2.5 billion; officials express hope that deluge of information will yield useful analysis as experts weigh in.
lead_paragraph: The data, the most detailed breakdown ever provided about the prescription claims of Medicare beneficiaries, included information about 36 million patients and $103 billion in spending.

headline.main: Medicare Releases Detailed Data on Prescription Drug Spending
headline.print_headline: Medicare Releases Detailed Data on Prescription Drug Spending

snippet: The data, the most detailed breakdown ever provided about the prescription claims of Medicare beneficiaries, included information about 36 million patients and $103 billion in spending.
